intro: Popowia obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed popowia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils.
